title: Of no significance, just commercial
review: I visited this temple with my family and kids, it is one of the landmarks on Rishikesh, but couldn't appreciate the purpose. There are idols of lots of deities installed in small or cramped rooms, just next to one another. There was no attendant nor some Pooja was performed. It appeared that the temples were about to close, hence, some staff begain shutting the doors, as if they are closing a commercial shop.

title: Don't miss the walk up!
review: Love this Temple in the evenings when the sun is setting and the Ganga Aarti begins. You can truly feel and connect with the spirituality and pilgramage of Rishikesh! The higher you go, the better! And on the way there are some sweet souvernir shops inside. Namaste!

title: Temple near Laxman Jhula
review: Tera Manzil temple is located on the farther side of Laxman Jhula. This temple is a very popular landmark in Rishikesh. This is a 13 storey temple hosting various idols of Gods and Goddesses.

title: Spiritual!
review: Go in the evening and watch the sunset from the top levels of the Temple, it is breath taking! Especially when the Ganga Aarti begins (also in the evenings) and the holy chantings are loudly heard throughout the twon through the loud speakers.

title: Great views but a long climb up 13 stories
review: We didnt see any temples in Rishikesh so decided upon seeing this one. A hectic cross over Lakshman Jhoola bridge and we were at the base of the temple where you leave your shoes with a shoe collector. We didnt really understand the point of this temple with its small rooms with deities inside and only one way up and down interspersed with shops?, but once there we knew we had to get to the top to see the view and say we did it. 13 stories high, we took our time and the views were sensational. I wouldnt say its a must do as we didnt understand its true significance but interesting to climb and watch the action down below.

title: Exception Building
review: The Temple was easily visible from Ram Jhula and Laxaman Jhula views of the temple is breathtaking. People do enjoy taking photographs from both the spot.

title: Best time is to visit this mandir is at evening while sunset.
review: Very beautiful Temple situated on other side of Laxman Jhoola. It shines when you see this from Laxman Jhoola while sunset.

title: One of the best architect of the temple ....
review: The name of the temple Tera Manzil is named as it has 13 floors .Each of the floor has some temples and on the peak it has the final temple of Shiva...The view is mesmerizing...One can see the people doing river rafting from there.One can view the one part of Rishikesh...laxman jula is nearby...People visit there for the view...One need to climb the 13 floors for the perfect  view...On each floor there are some shops which are open and close.

title: Tryambkeshwar temple
review: Tryambkeshwar temple is a must visit place when in Rishikesh. It is situated on the banks of river Ganga near Laxmanjhoola. It has thirteen floors hence the name Tera Manzil Temple.

title: Beautiful lighting in the evening
review: This temple is located just right beside the Laksman Jhula brudge, it is mostly beautiful to see in the evening because of the colourful lighting. And it also held the aarti every evening eventho not as big as in Parmarth or Triveni ghat.

title: Great Pleasure
review: If you are looking for happiness, do not forget to see the magnificent temple of this 13th floor. It really enjoys very much.

title: Its beautiful temple with 13 floors
review: you will get great view of 13 Storey Trambkeshwar temple from Laxman Jhula.  You will get different version of various god / goddess at various small temples at every floors of the temple.  We could not climb entire 13 floor.

title: Iconic temple of Rishikesh
review: As named, it has 13 floors of numerous Hindu Deities. Below the temple at the bank of holy river Ganga, there is a good space for Arti and devotees can spend a good time in peace and can enjoy their peaceful time.

title: Not pleasant at all
review: Really I don't get the interest to go to this place. It's noisy with all the beeping horns outside, polluted and always people asking you money!

title: Good temple.
review: Personally not a fan of temples but this place is good. It has 13 floor as the name suggest. It's a good place to view sunrise. You will have nice view of ganga river, lakshman jhula and sunrise from the top floor. It is near lakshman jhula and it has shoping complex.

title: Next to Laxman Jhula
review: This place is best to see sunrise in the morning. Its a huge temple of 13th floor, so if you have older family members, please avoid.

title: Eyecatcher of Rishikesh, you can not leave without visiting ita
review: This temple is the famous eyecatcher of Rishikesh. It is not specific a touristic place but more a religious place. You can visit it without entrance fee. You have to take of your shoes and they ask same money for it (be aware you don't pay at start and end, they try to let you pay twice). The temple itself has long galleries with statues and little shops. You have to walk along all galleries round so be aware it is a long walk up. Every floor has bells to ring meaning two things: 1. God wake up, we are there and 2. Create energy for all good and positivity. Most Indian people visit the temple to do there prayers and ceremonies. The temple is next to Laxman Jhula.

title: Temple of Hindu
review: One of beautiful temple on bord of Gaga river .all God & goddess are there

title: view is very good from top
review: Tera Manzil Temple is a major landmark and a multi-storey temple located on the banks of river Ganga near Lakshman Jhula in Rishikesh. This temple is also known as Kailash Niketan Temple and is one of the most significant places of worship in Rishikesh.

title: The most terrible place to be called a temple - AWFULL
review: I was shocked by what i have seen in this place,a huge place which resembles likes a old shopping stores mart with individual stores & guess whats inside stores - our gods kept inside ,it was painful for me to see this,none of the gods are cleaned,not worshiped,no flowers,nothing... there is no divinity & top of that on very floor both corners have shops selling stuff

title: VERY NICE VIEWS AND LOCATION
review: Difficult to navigate building and nobody there to show you the way. Just have to go in and drop shoes and figure it all out, basically without a guide not really worth the visit

title: Nice view from Top
review: I would say this is more of a commercial temple near Laxman Jhula. No one there to guide or help you at temple. Gives a great view of the river and city from top.

title: aarti
review: we took part in the aarti at this temple and liked it very much for its nice, very personal way of including everybody

title: Trumbhekesahwar Temple with nice views
review: Next to Laxman Jhula this is not an ancient temple and is build by a trust. Has 13 floors each floor having idols of different Gods and Goddesses. For those unable to climb many stairs one can visit 1-2 floors and get back. From 3rd floor onwards it offers amazing view of Ganges and Laxman Jhula. We came back after visiting 3 floors.

title: 13 floor temple
review: This is the first temple I had seen that has 13 floors and each floor having the idols of different gods.

title: Vareity but expensive
review: Visited this laxman jhula temple . Many floors by stairs. No lift .many shopping shops variety but little coastly

title: Mind Blowing temple
review: The temple is devoted to the lord Shiv and having various statue of lord shiv and others. The temple is a great work of architect and constructed in a planned manner. The evening Ganga Arti is performed in  forecourt of the temple in front of Ganga beneath Laxman Jhula.  To watch the rafting people from the top of the temple is a great pleasure.

title: Big temple complex
review: Rishikesh is a blessed land of spiritual importance located on the shores of Ganga . This multi storeyed temple is located opposite the Laxman Jhula on the East bank . Various deities are worshipped in this big temple complex. Looks all the more beautiful when lighted well ,in the evening.

title: Best Example when Temple Turn as a Business Center.
review: My son liked the complex and he liked to visit. As I started going floor after floor of this Tera Manzil Temple, first thing came to my mind is a shopping mall. After each temple, there is a shop, selling ring, yantra etc to change your life :) Inside the temple, priest asking money...

title: i like it
review: the place is nice, you can see it from the other side to the river, i took some shoots for it, from outside and inside it very nice.

title: Great view from the top!
review: One can visit this temple free of cost, each floor has many rooms with different gods and devis, one goes ringing the bells all the way up. From the top there is a beautiful view  definitely worth the walk up.

title: amazing temple with good views
review: this temple is very close to laxman jhula. it is very big temple and looks amazing. it has 13 floors and on every floor different statue of god. a must visit place

title: Temple
review: The temple holds smaller temples of God and Goddesses. I do not think these are worshipped but if one wants to chant, they can sit and do the same.

title: Unique temple
review: When I visited this temple i had the best view of river ganga and the lakshman jhoola at the same time.  The place is mesmerizing and refreshing at the same time.

title: Nice visit
review: Amazing Ganga views from this temple. It is very near to laxman jhoola. The temple holds smaller temples of God and Goddesses. Many shops have been opened which sell religious stuff

title: a confluence of temples
review: So many small temples in this one big temple. the footwear guy is always welcoming devotees with a smile. and one starts going around all the temples exploring every floor and as we go up, the view of the city gets better until you reach the top where the main idol is there. from the top most floor, the view is awesome. you can sit back at any of the small temples and meditate, worship or relax. the peacefulness at this place is amazing

title: A beautiful temple on the Holy river Ganga !!
review: A beautiful temple with the idols of all the Gods, located on the banks of the Ganga. It is near Laxman Jhula and dominates the Tapovan area of Rishikesh. Attended the evening Ganga arti which should not be missed by anyone visiting the temple.

title: If you have time, do visit
review: This temple is a little commercial, but still.. worth a visit. all Hindu Gods / Goddesses under one roof and this was an eye opener. Walking up is easy and non-tiring.

title: unique temple
review: This temple is unique and has many rooms with various idols.As you go up the floors, the width is narrowing...unique style

title: Nice view from top. .
review: This temple is located near the end of laxman zhula.. various goddesses and god idols is present in each floor.. but it seems to be more on commercial side many shops r present on each floor..you get nice view from the top of laxman jhula n ganga ..its not a must visit place to be frank but if you have time do visit ..

title: attraction of  numerous  Hindu Gods/Godesses under a roof.
review: Situated in front of Laxman Jhula. one can have a holy darshan of numerous Hindu Gods/Godesses under a roof.

title: Giant Structure beside Lakshman Jhula
review: You can get perfect photo of Tera Manzil Temple from the Lakshman Jhula. After crossing Lakshman Jhula, visit this temple. You can get a glimpse of almost all Hindu Gods in this temple.

title: Its very beautifully build temple.
review: This temple is seen from Lakshman Jhulla and it gives such a beautiful view from there and its huge.

title: Looks beautiful
review: Viewed this from the Ganga during rafting and from Laxman Jhula, did not venture actually at the temple. Looks very nice and neat.

title: A thirteen story temple complex near Laxman jhula.
review: This thirteen storied temple and shopping complex is found at one end of Laxman Jhula in Rishikesh. Where idols of all the major shrines in India are available across the thirteen floors interspace do with shops selling the articles like Rudharkshas, Asta Dhatu rings, Rudraksha makas, sphatika malas, sandalwood pieces etc

title: One of the Holiest places
review: I am fortunate to have visited this place. This is by the side of Lakshman Jhula. The look from outside is deceptive. When I looked from the Lakshman Jhula the multistory building (I think 11 stories high) looked like a shopping complex with a temple at the top but once I went inside I was surprised, all the shuttered cubicles were not shops but each had a deity. You could worship all the Gods. Most of the Hindu Gods are placed in this temple. This is 11 story high multiple temples in a single temple. Great. Moreover the evening Ganga aarti was very good and I was fortunate and blessed to participate and take part in the Aarti along with my wife.

title: amazing
review: The idols of almost all Hindu deities are located in this temple.Experience of seeing the Laxman Jhula Bridge and Rishikesh town from the temple's highest floor was fantastic

title: 13 stories
review: Peaceful and all of the deities are there. The bells are there to ring. I found it so humorous that there were shops selling style on each floor of this amazing building. The views are breathtaking

title: peceful place
review: all hindu idols there. you can see this temple from lakshman jhula with great view. it was not much crowed nd very peaceful

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE
review: This temple is located right on the River Ganges. Symmetrical Idols of Gods of various famous Indian religious spots are located inside the thirteen floors of this temple. The only disadvantage is - for aged people, walking up the stairs to the thirteenth floor is virtually impossible. We could not - we gave up on the fifth floor.

title: Must Sees Of Rishikesh
review: Its a 13 storey temple on one side of the Lakhshaman Jhoola( suspended bridge). It has lots of Bells which people strike as they move from one floor to another.

title: Spiritual place
review: Good example of newdays spirituality. It is possible to go up stairs to the top of building and see very nice view of Ganga, Ganga valley and all Rishikesh

title: Must see in Rishikesh!
review: Trayambakeshwar Temple is also called Tera Manzil because of its 13 storeyed structure. It is believed that the prayers offered at the Trimbakeshwar – ‘Abode of the three eyed one‘ are fulfilled. Lord Shiva in the form of a magnificent Lingam is the main deity. The temple is also adorned with idols of various gods and goddesses from Hindu mythology, in each floor. You also have bells to ring when you cross them. We didn't climb all the way to the 13th floor but it would be a great place to see the sunset from.

title: Ring out wild bells!
review: We attended an aarti at the Tera Manzil temple and it was a great experience. It is accessed by the Lakshman jhula so both these iconic structures can be visited in the span of a single evening with the possibility of adding the Ram jhula as well. We didn't climb all the way to the 13th floor but it would be a great place to see the sunset from. Each floor is lined with statues and images of Gods and Goddesses. Certainly worth a visit.

title: Wedding Cake Temple
review: This temple is one layer upon another each with corridors round the outside & then you walk into each of the small rooms (like cells) which each always have 3 deities in them & mainly  a bell in front of each god. THere are no descriptions but a guy on the ground floor jumped up to instruct us that payments had to be made in each room & that the final one on the ground floor with Bramha in needed 200 / 500rupee minimum!!!! He also wants a healthy tip so shrug him off quickly before you are 700 rupees poorer. Most of the other visitors appeared to give 10rupees each in 1 or 2 rooms.

title: Awesome View of Ganga River
review: Tera Manzil temple is in Rishikesh near Laxman Jhula. It is a river side temple with 13 floors. Each floor has small temples of different god/goddesses and shops from where you can buy some religious stuff. You can have a great view of hills, ganga river and laxman jhula from the top floor. There is a ganga arti in the evening which is must attend.

title: Beautiful temple
review: Tera Manjil temple is a beautiful temple beside Lakshman Jhula. You will find a lot of idols of Hindu deities there. You can also click full length of lakshman jhula from the temple.

title: Ring the bells
review: Every window has a bell to ring and you climb up all the floors, the view is stunning. AT the top you can get a raksha ( red ribbon around your wrist) for a small donation and the priest will pray for you or a loved one.

title: Impressive size but quite commercialised
review: It's safe enough and inexpensive to leave your shoes at the entrance as you must but some of the concrete walkways get very hot in the sun.

title: 13 Mazil
review: This place has various names as per the locales. This is one of the most iconic structures in Rishikesh after Laxman jhoola.

title: A Thirteen Storied Temple, which can be climbed, without any strain
review: This Temple Complex situated on the banks of River Ganges, adjacent to Laxman Jhula Bridge attracts most of the tourists due to its Majesticity & height. Even though it has ten plus floors, I feel aged persons can also climb this Temple, without much strain, as one has to go round this Complex, every time, before climbing each floor and while doing so, one can, not only see gods/goddess, as well as commercial shops housed in this Temple Complex, but also have the glimpses of Rishikesh town and in particular River Ganges & Laxman Jhula Bridge, in different elevation, in a serene atmosphere. But it is astonishing that, they haven’t fixed any entrance fees, to visit this Temple building, which in my opinion should have been fixed, which would fetch revenue to maintain this huge Complex.

title: Divine and Serene
review: Tera Manzil a very famous temple in rishikesh and a very good popular tourist spot also. It is truly a very calm and divine place.

title: Nice trek up the stairs
review: Must see... and ring all the bells along the stairs. Don't miss out Vini yoga in the basement of the temple.

title: A place to visit!!
review: This temple can be described as temple where you can see all the deities plus scenic beauty of Ganges at the up-most height gives you piece of mind.

title: Temple that looks like a shopping
review: I was looking for Tera Manzil Temple and I went there but I thought: maybe I'm wrong, this is not a temple, this is a shopping. But was there! To my surprise, is a mix of many box selling jewellery, handcrafted, religious articles, and with Hindu shrines in between.

title: quite a walk....
review: as the name suggest, this temple is built on 13 storeys and if you wish to reach the top floor, you need to climb up. each floor is lined with statues and sculptures of gods, goddesses, saints and you continuing praying at each as you walk up and ...there you reach the top.

title: Best Ganga Aarti
review: One of the tallest temples I have seen. Though Triveni Ghat Aarti & Parmarth Niketan Aarti are the most sought after Ghats for Ganga Aarti, I found Tera Manzil Temple Ghat or Trimbakeshwar Ghat Aarti the best - for the peaceful aarti. When  I was here with my friends, we got an opportunity of offering Aarti ourselves which we would have never got at other 2 places mentioned.

title: Bells
review: You keep climbing here and ring the big bells.  you will enjoy visiting this temple.  it is just on Lakshman jhoola.

title: Gods in every room
review: Gods in every rooms, with full of service and amenities for gods.

title: Locals love it
review: We visited it on a very busy Sunday morning and were the only overseas looking tourists there. It was very interesting to see how the place is used. We really liked the spiralling walk to the top, but photography is not permitted at all while on site, so the views have to be savoured to commit to memory. The views of the river and Jhula are especially good from up top. Ring some bells on the way.

title: Dead templ
review: There are corridors of little rooms with three gods in each in a diaorama on the first floor.

title: Ok but don't get too excited
review: A big stack of shrines and stalls selling tat on many levels. Good views onto Ganga and Laksam jhula

title: Too much of work in climbing
review: has scluptures of many gods/ godesses ...not really sure whether it is worth the effort...you need to decide for yourself...its a 13 mazil climb

title: Lord Traimbakeswara Temple
review: The entire shrine is full of temples. On the top sits the Lord Traimbakesara. Wonderful Spiritual Journey.

title: Every Manzil Shiv Shiv Shiv
review: Just Step In This Temple All The Great Lords Of Hindus Are There But In Center Shiva In The Various Form Found Jai Shiv Sankar In Side Ganga River Flow And A Beautiful View Of Laxman Jhula From Top Is Amazing

title: 13 floors and lots of bells
review: Great experience defiantly worth walking all the way up to the top the view of then Ganges River is breathtaking. Go earlier in the morning because it does get quite busy after that and you can't enjoy it as much.

title: Quaint structure
review: The temple is on the road and the banks of Ganga and each room of sorts is devoted to a different God, built in stories and like a triangle.

title: good place for religious folks
review: it is a nice sightseeing spot if you have extra time or doing religious tourism, otherwise nothing major

title: AMAZING
review: Its so so much of love. So heavenly with full energy. But this temple needs climbing to the top. As you go up from the 2nd floor you can see and pray each different deities. And Shiva on the top. Just next to ganga and surrounded with beautiful mountains.

title: Grand
review: Temple adds to the beauty of the rishikesh and laxman jhula. One can visit this temple after crossing the ram jhula.Can try sapt dhatu rings inside the temple premise. Also, on the back side of the temple is the mighty ganges. No lift, only staircase.

title: Would you like to buy a bangle with your blessing?
review: The Tera Manzil Temple, also known as the Trayambakeshwar  Temple, is one of Rishikesh's most iconic buildings. Each floor is filled with small shrines and brass bells. However, between many shrines are shops selling religious trinkets, and the priests and staff uncomfortably request donations. There is no photography allowed and the surely staff berated an innocent Indian family near me for snapping a shot. If you're curious, climb the stairs and enjoy the great views but don't expect beautiful darshan.

title: Tera Manzil Temple
review: amazing temple , located at the end of the second bridge Lakshman Jhoola,

title: nice temple
review: nice temple , situated near to laxman jhula , walking distance from laxman jhula. nice temple , but alots of shop there , shopkeeper wanna attract/disturb  you for buying there product(this is not good),

title: beautiful and creative design
review: this temple design amaze you and when you play rafting then you will see this temple and its beauty will catch your heart and you will definitely say that i want to go inside this temple.

title: Nice structure that turned into really bad shoping center
review: The architecture is very interesting and the view is wonderful but this place has like 50 stores inside and you have to pass by each one of them (all sell the same things)  and to avoid them all.

title: Beautiful temple at river Ganga side
review: One can take benefit out of the Holy Darshan of no. of Hindu Deities while Moving around the floors of the 13 floored temple.

title: A very nice climb up to the top!
review: You leave your shoes at the bottom of the temple and get a token.Then you climb up each floor passing lots of little temples and temple offering shops.There are lots of steps to climb but take it easy,look at the amazing view and ring the bells!Best views in the evening due to sun.

title: Unexpectedly lovely
review: We walked up to the highest levels and really enjoyed ringing the bells, soaking in the magical atmosphere and the nice view. Definitely a must do in Rishikesh.

title: City View from the Temple is Wonderful
review: This is a very old temple with many hindu deities. Once you reach the top most storey you would enjoy the great view of the city.

title: Good view
review: Huge temple near the bridge. Very good view at Ganges from top floors, but be prepared, that during you will go upstairs there will be several man who will "claim" donationf from you.

title: nice
review: it was a  situated at the side of river ganga for view you keep on climbing the stairs n watching gods n goddesses

title: Big temple
review: As its name tere manzil temple it has total 13 numbers of floors and every floors there are temple of different god and some shop is there. There is no lift so you have to go to 13th floor by walking only.
oh as the anme suggest it is a temple with thirteen stories with idols opf gods and godesses all around

title: Tallest Temple in Town
review: As the name suggested this is 13 story temple. You have to climb stairs to reach at the top & as you go up its becomes narrow. You can have a great view of surrounding from top.

title: Interesting and different
review: Interesting structure. After you remove your shoes and pay for storage (you are not allowed to put the shoes into your bag, you can leave them on the street if you want) you may start climbing the stairs. At the each alter you are encouraged to make donation especially if you do not look local. Views are great. Over all not in the best shape but worth the experience.

title: 13 Storey Temple!!!!
review: I saw this temple from the Laxman Jhulla but did not visit it.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: This temple is very old and beautiful opposite in gangga very nice vice of this site nearest location and food is good.

title: Temple in small shops, very unique.....
review: Majestic view for sure from Laxman Jhulla. Need to be physically fit to climb all the 13 floors. As any Hindu religious place, the temple has deities of all gods & goddesses. In addition to the deities in shops there are lots of shops selling, rudraksh, stones etc...so  its a mixture of temples & shops. Its more of a fun trip till the top, with a very good view of the Lakshman Jhulla. Lots of monkeys in and around the temple to feed.

title: just keep ringing bells
review: u will enjoy climbing up and ringing bells.  the message on walls are  gud to read.  it is just next to laxman jhoola

title: Beautiful view
review: Best part is that, it is near laxman lhulla market. On the lowest level , there are daily yoga classses.

title: On top
review: Its a good temple in Laxman Jhula after crossing the bridge. when you go on top you will have a great view. Also of religious values

title: 13 stories high temple
review: The concept of having a 13 story high temple in this mountainous region itself is awe-inspiring but trust me,the climb up is not.

title: i love rishikesh ...i live here...
review: rishikesh is simply diffrent from other cities...rishikesh is world yoga capital ...rishikesh is tourist place.... ganga flowing from middle ..... ..ou can contact me from more information    +919760385133

title: excellent place to view.
review: 30 temples are present in this place.many shops are inside surrounding of this every story of building.sight scene from above this temple is gre8.

title: Great views
review: My sister and I visited the temple recently and found it really interesting. The only downside was the people hassling us to give a blessing in exchange for money. Great views of the river from the top.

title: All at one place
review: It's a 13 story building, with many small temples at each n every story. I this temple u can see almost all the Hindu gods at one place. But the best thing is the top. From top u can see the Ganges, the mountains n all the near by area n Laxman jhoola.

title: wonderful  building
review: elegant and wonderful piece of religious importance all the 12 jyotilingas at one place for old people who cannot visit all this places awesome location near the ganga

title: Thirteen stories temple of all god and goddess
review: We have visited this temple during our Yoga retreat at Rishikesh. Its very big temple. This temple having thirteen floor. Lots of statues are there of god and goddess. I like this temple

title: climb only if you want the view
review: only the view from top makes it worth the climb.  can be so much better with proper  managament. hopefully

title: I am in heaven
review: It's close to Laxman Jhoola , here you will find lot of small rooms like temples dedicated to varied Hindu god , view of both's the Ganga and Hills are breathtaking , it's wee bit hard to get 13 floor but once you are there you will you can see the natural beauties after like feel in heaven ! Must visit

title: Good Scenic view
review: 13 stories  building on river bank..It was difficult to climb on top but the scenic beauty from the  top is worth mentioning.

title: Lot's of God in One Temple
review: In Tera Manzil Temple not one god but lot's of God is here. The is beauty of temple. This temple located in near of Laxman Jhula. This is a beautiful temple.

title: Must visit....
review: Serene, tranquil, mystic, religious, spiritual, peaceful.......describe it in whatever way you like.....a very soothing and enjoyable place. Must visit place in Rishikesh.

title: Almost all Gods at a single mandir
review: Great view of Ganga as you go up the steps...while you take blessings of Gods.

title: historic God place
review: This place holds significance as per Hindu mythology, and has 13 floors full of various 'avtars' of Hindu Gods. Good place to get blessings from all the Gods in one go. Other than that, the place offers great view of the scenery from top floor. Good photo place.

title: Not to miss
review: This is a temple scattered in 13 floors.  The first two floors we have various small temples of various Gods and Goddess.  Every floor there are various temples till the 13th floor.  The view of Ganga is superb from the top floor.  Its not compulsory to go all the 13 floors.  It depends on ones capacity if they could climb.  Go for it.

title: Multistorey temple
review: This place is like visiting a multistorey apartment full of various Gods. Quite a sacred place for Hindu devotees. Its quite a climb as well. Its a worthwhile addition to your itinerary. Take a good zoom camera for nice pics from top.

title: Unique temple
review: This is a 13 storey modern temple complex located just beside the famous Lakshman Jhoola. Not a sacred place as such but worth visiting for its uniqueness. In every floor there are temples dedicated to various Hindu Gods and Goddess. One needs to be fit enough to climb also. View of the Ganges and mountains from the top is amazing.

title: Tera Manzil Temple – On the Top
review: The first reason that my friends loved this place was due to its prime location and breath taking views from the top. It is based on step by step journey and we saw different Gods on different levels. The stairs are steep but we loved the progressing journey and the views offered from the top.

title: Keep climbing !!
review: Tera Manzil is right on the river banks near the Laxman Jhoola.

title: A centrally-located marvel
review: A lot of small rooms like temples dedicated to varied Hindu deities..! As it is just adjacent to Laxman-Jhula, you could easily visit there if you have some extra time in hand. A totally different concept..

title: Show me Heaven...
review: If have to be there to see what the top of this amazing temple has to offer. The views of both the Ganges and the Hills are breathtaking! Start from the bottom and you find various forms of Hindu Gods on each floor. The way through the stairs is engrossing and it's a wee bit hard to get to the top but once you are there you can see the natural beauties afar. Feels like Heaven!

title: good exercise for good view
review: do climb up and do come down .  when up there do look around. birds eye view of the jhula, ganga and the town

title: Enjoy the beauty of the temple and the view of Rishikesh from top
review: The mandir is located just north to Laxman jhula which is beutiful in itself.

title: Temple near Laxman Jhula
review: Tera Manzil temple is located on the farther side of Laxman Jhula. This temple is a very popular landmark in Rishikesh. This is a 13 storey temple hosting various idols of Gods and Goddesses.

title: Beautiful n religious. .
review: Tera manzil temple is such religious site.on every floor of temple u can visit many Hindu God figure.

title: Of no significance, just commercial
review: I visited this temple with my family and kids, it is one of the landmarks on Rishikesh, but couldn't appreciate the purpose. There are idols of lots of deities installed in small or cramped rooms, just next to one another. There was no attendant nor some Pooja was performed. It appeared that the temples were about to close, hence, some staff begain shutting the doors, as if they are closing a commercial shop.

title: Spiritual!
review: Go in the evening and watch the sunset from the top levels of the Temple, it is breath taking! Especially when the Ganga Aarti begins (also in the evenings) and the holy chantings are loudly heard throughout the twon through the loud speakers.

title: Exception Building
review: The Temple was easily visible from Ram Jhula and Laxaman Jhula views of the temple is breathtaking. People do enjoy taking photographs from both the spot.

title: Great views but a long climb up 13 stories
review: We didnt see any temples in Rishikesh so decided upon seeing this one. A hectic cross over Lakshman Jhoola bridge and we were at the base of the temple where you leave your shoes with a shoe collector. We didnt really understand the point of this temple with its small rooms with deities inside and only one way up and down interspersed with shops?, but once there we knew we had to get to the top to see the view and say we did it. 13 stories high, we took our time and the views were sensational. I wouldnt say its a must do as we didnt understand its true significance but interesting to climb and watch the action down below.

title: Best time is to visit this mandir is at evening while sunset.
review: Very beautiful Temple situated on other side of Laxman Jhoola. It shines when you see this from Laxman Jhoola while sunset.

title: Don't miss the walk up!
review: Love this Temple in the evenings when the sun is setting and the Ganga Aarti begins. You can truly feel and connect with the spirituality and pilgramage of Rishikesh! The higher you go, the better! And on the way there are some sweet souvernir shops inside. Namaste!

title: Tryambkeshwar temple
review: Tryambkeshwar temple is a must visit place when in Rishikesh. It is situated on the banks of river Ganga near Laxmanjhoola. It has thirteen floors hence the name Tera Manzil Temple.

title: One of the best architect of the temple ....
review: The name of the temple Tera Manzil is named as it has 13 floors .Each of the floor has some temples and on the peak it has the final temple of Shiva...The view is mesmerizing...One can see the people doing river rafting from there.One can view the one part of Rishikesh...laxman jula is nearby...People visit there for the view...One need to climb the 13 floors for the perfect  view...On each floor there are some shops which are open and close.

title: Great Pleasure
review: If you are looking for happiness, do not forget to see the magnificent temple of this 13th floor. It really enjoys very much.

There are idols of lots of deities installed in small or cramped rooms, just next to one another. There was no attendant nor some Pooja was performed. It appeared that the temples were about to close, hence, some staff begain shutting the doors, as if they are closing a commercial shop.
